info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 10:31PM AST until April 20 at 2:00AM AST by NWS San Juan PR
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Vega Alta and Vega Baja.
* WHEN...Until 200 AM AST.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Various roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1025 PM AST, emergency management reported flooding in the warned area due to flood waters from Rio Cibuco. Flooding is already occurring, causing various road closures. Flood waters are currently affecting road PR-160 in Sector Arenales, Barrio Rio Bajo in Vega Baja and road PR-2 near intersection with PR-690 in Vega Alta. Portions of roads PR-675 and PR-676 are also impassable. Up to 8 inches of rain have fallen upstream, bringing Rio Cibuco to a moderate flood state, around 15.40m. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM AST SUNDAY

area.areaDesc: Vega Alta, PR; Vega Baja, PR
